content.raw: physics -> common
Check
physics -> common
Check
Missing doc string
Added.
Remove either `passing` or `specifying`
Fixed.
Missing doc string for param `_encoding`
Got it.
Why Base64 encoding, instead of writing the binary bzip2 data?   Base64 will inflate the binary data, negating some of the benefit of compressing it.
content.html: Why Base64 encoding, instead of writing the binary bzip2 data? Base64 will inflate the binary data, negating some of the benefit of compressing it.

content.raw: OK, now I see that the log file format is XML.  Is that warranted?  I was imagining a newline-separated key=value metadata section followed by chunks.
content.html: OK, now I see that the log file format is XML. Is that warranted? I was imagining a newline-separated key=value metadata section followed by chunks.

content.raw: It allows use an off-the-shelve parser. Modification of the log format is also easy, anyone can understand the log file, and it's portable.
content.html: It allows use an off-the-shelve parser. Modification of the log format is also easy, anyone can understand the log file, and it's portable.

content.raw: Makes sense to me.
Suggest using boost::filesystem::path for better portability.
There is no portable way to get the user's home directory. However, I did change "this->logPathname" to be a boost::filesystem::path.
content.html: There is no portable way to get the user's home directory. However, I did change "this->logPathname" to be a boost::filesystem::path.

content.raw: If it's not safe to `Init()` twice (and it looks like it might not be, as the log location gets changed; not sure what that does to open log files), then `Init()` should refuse to execute twice.  As an alternative, you could offer a `SetLogDirectory()` method.
content.html: If it's not safe to Init() twice (and it looks like it might not be, as the log location gets changed; not sure what that does to open log files), then Init() should refuse to execute twice. As an alternative, you could offer a SetLogDirectory() method.

content.raw: Done, made init check for double initialization.
content.html: Done, made init check for double initialization.

content.raw: Move the `delete` call inside the previous `if()` clause.
content.html: Move the delete call inside the previous if() clause.

content.raw: Not necessary: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6330867/doesnt-null-check-before-delete-free-optimize-out-the-call-to-the-function
Well, you learn something new every day.
content.html: Well, you learn something new every day.

content.raw: Check.
I think that that comment is wrong (i.e., it does to write to disk here).
content.html: I think that that comment is wrong (i.e., it does to write to disk here).

content.raw: Check.
Any bad implications of sleeping here?  E.g., get behind on writing data out to disk?  Can you just block on the condition variable instead?
content.html: Any bad implications of sleeping here? E.g., get behind on writing data out to disk? Can you just block on the condition variable instead?

content.raw:
The condition is set every iteration when something is moving in simulation. This would cause a lot of small disk writes. 

Each write will dump all the data in the buffer to disk. When gazebo is closed it also writes the remaining info to disk. 

I think the only downside if gazebo crashes, we could loose 2seconds of data.
content.html:
The condition is set every iteration when something is moving in simulation. This would cause a lot of small disk writes.

Each write will dump all the data in the buffer to disk. When gazebo is closed it also writes the remaining info to disk.

I think the only downside if gazebo crashes, we could loose 2seconds of data.

content.raw: Got it.
Suggest changing the filenames and classes to either be Read/Write or Record/Play.
content.html: Suggest changing the filenames and classes to either be Read/Write or Record/Play.

content.raw: Changed to Record/Play.
I know this is already merged, but code_check.sh just found this reference to gazebo/common/LogWrite.hh, which should be LogRecord.hh
content.html: I know this is already merged, but code_check.sh just found this reference to gazebo/common/LogWrite.hh, which should be LogRecord.hh
